title: Nick Jonas is recovering from bike accident
body: Nick Jonas is recovering from bike accidentBy Lisa Respers France, CNNUpdated 11:47 AM ET, Tue May 18, 2021 JUST WATCHEDNick Jonas returns to 'The Voice' after bike accidentReplayMore Videos ...MUST WATCH (16 Videos)Nick Jonas returns to 'The Voice' after bike accidentKate Hudson snips off boyfriend's ponytailLovato reveals they are nonbinary, changing their pronounsVideo: 'SNL' cold open goes over new mask rulesEmotional Ellen DeGeneres announces her show is endingChild reporter who interviewed Obama has died at 23Michael Jordan reveals last the text message from Kobe BryantKareem Abdul-Jabbar on NBA's new Social Justice Champion AwardWoman wakes days after surgery with different accentJoan Rivers' luxurious (and haunted?) NYC penthouse lists for $38MBillie Eilish admits wearing Billie Eilish wig on talk showSydney Sweeney scolds internet trolls on InstagramDylan Dreyer of "Today" reveals her pregnancy with bun-themed videoRob Gronkowski says he could beat Tom Brady at cornhole and hopes fans return to stadiumsWatch: Former Obama speechwriter trolls Newsmax anchor live on TVRare purple-pink diamond could break auction record (CNN)Singer/actor and recently returned "The Voice" coach Nick Jonas has revealed details following reports he was hospitalized over the weekend.Jonas was asked at the top of Monday's episode by "The Voice" host Carson Daily how he was feeling, to which the coach responded that he was doing OK."I've been better, but I'm doing all right," Jonas said as he held his side. "Cracked rib from a spill on a bike and a few other bumps and bruises. But I just want to go ahead and say that, in case I'm not as physically enthusiastic as I usually am."He also had a request for fellow coach Blake Shelton."Blake, please don't make me laugh as much, because it hurts to laugh," said Jonas.Read MoreShelton quipped that the singer was "just trying to get sympathy votes on the show."Yeah, a big elaborate plan," Jonas shot back.Jonas, who is one third of the group The Jonas Brothers, and had previously debuted as a coach during Season 18 of "The Voice" which aired in spring 2020. He returned this year for Season 20. He has a well known love for motorcycles and appeared in a recent video for "The Voice" popping a wheelie on one as he arrived on set for the show."Welcome back Nick," said fellow coach Kelly Clarkson in the video."Always got to make an entrance," their fellow coach, John Legend, added.
